description.p: You practice the grim art of swift elimination through stealth, poison, and deception.
When you choose this subclass at 3rd level, you gain the following features.
You gain proficiency with the Disguise Kit and the Poisonerâ€™s Kit.
You're adept at ambushing a target, granting you the following benefits.
Initiative. You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.
Surprising Strikes. During the first round of each combat, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn.
If your Sneak Attack hits any target during that round, the target takes extra damage of the weapon's type equal to your Rogue level.

sheet.description: You have Advantage on Initiative rolls. During first round of combat: you have Advantage on attacks vs creatures that have not yet acted. If you Sneak Attack the target during that turn, add {{level:rogue}} extra damage.

description.p: You are expert at the following techniques that aid your infiltrations.
Masterful Mimicry. You can unerringly mimic another person's speech, handwriting, or both if you have spent at least 1 hour studying them.
Roving Aim. Your Speed isn't reduced to 0 by using Steady Aim.

sheet.description: You can unerringly mimic another person's speech, handwriting, or both if you have spent at least 1 hour studying them.
Your Speed isn't reduced to 0 by using Steady Aim.

description.p: When you use the Poison option of your Cunning Strike, the target also takes 2d6 Poison damage whenever it fails the saving throw. This damage ignores Resistance to Poison damage.

sheet.description: When you use the Poison option of your Cunning Strike, the target also takes 2d6 Poison damage whenever it fails the saving throw. This damage ignores Resistance to Poison damage.

description.p: When you hit with your Sneak Attack on the first round of a combat, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus), or the attack's damage is doubled against the target.

sheet.description: When you Sneak Attack on first round, the target must succeed on a CON Saving Throw DC{{death strike:dc}} or suffer doubled damage.
